ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: The course pushed skills developed in previous design courses further by challenging students with 2 large, open-ended projects. Students learned to organize large-scale projects and refine them over the course of the semester.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The two projects were great! The class structure could have allowed for a third project (smaller than the two). While individual critques were very helpful and efficient, group crits were much more of an educational experience, given the fact that students could compare work and process. Perhaps group crits of 5 or so students could combine the efficiency and educational value of the two critique formats.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes; I would recommend this course to any student who has already taken several design courses. The projects are much more open-ended and far larger-scale than those of preceding courses; therefore, I would recommend this course to students who feel comfortable with their design process and have a high level of design capability/theory.
